paragraphs.text:
%md
# Load CSV Data

This code loads the `nyc-jobs.csv` file that will be used as the primary data source.

msg.data:
Load CSV Data

This code loads the nyc-jobs.csv file that will be used as the primary data source.

paragraphs.text:
val data = spark.read
    .format("csv")
    .option("header", "true")
    .load("/data/nyc-jobs.csv")

msg.data: data: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [Job ID: string, Agency: string ... 26 more fields]

A major initiative of the MHIL is the Connection to Care (C2C) program. To increase positive outcomes for vulnerable New Yorkers in their communities and identify effective new strategies for addressing the mental health at the community level, the Mayorâ€™s Fund to Advance NYC, the Mayorâ€™s Office for Economic Opportunity (NYC Opportunity), and the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) developed Connections to Care (C2C). This five-year, $30M initiative tests a model of partnerships between 15 community-based organizations (CBOs) paired with a licensed mental health provider (MHPs). Through this partnership, CBO staff receive ongoing training and coaching in a core set of mental health skills (Screening, Mental Health First Aid, Psychoeducation and Motivational Interviewing) that are incorporated into daily programming at the CBO. businessTitles: org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset[org.apache.spark.sql.Row] = [Business Title: string]

paragraphs.text:
// get a list of business titles converted to sentence case
val displayBusinessTitles = businessTitles
    .map(row=>(
            row(0).toString,
            row(0).toString
                .toLowerCase
                .split(" ")
                .map(_.capitalize)
                .mkString(" ")
        ))
    .toDF("Business Title", "Display Title")

z.show(displayBusinessTitles)

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Count Job Postings
Do a simple query that shows the number of `Job Postings` per `Level`.

msg.data:
Count Job Postings

Do a simple query that shows the number of Job Postings per Level.

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql

SELECT Level, COUNT(*) AS `Job Postings`
FROM nycData
WHERE `Salary Frequency` = "Annual"
GROUP BY Level
ORDER BY Level

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Top 10 Business Titles
Get a list of the top 10 Business Titles

msg.data:
Top 10 Business Titles

Get a list of the top 10 Business Titles

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql
SELECT
    bt.`Display Title`,
    COUNT(*) AS Total
    
FROM nycData jb
    LEFT OUTER JOIN businessTitles bt
        ON jb.`Business Title` = bt.`Business Title`

GROUP BY
    bt.`Display Title`
    
ORDER BY
    Total DESC
    
LIMIT
    10

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Annual Salary Distribution

msg.data: Annual Salary Distribution

paragraphs.text:
%spark.sql
SELECT 
    round( ((`Salary Range From` + `Salary Range To`) / 2) / 10000, 0) * 10000 AS Salary,
    COUNT(1) AS Value
    
FROM
   nycData 
    
WHERE 
    `Salary Frequency` = "Annual"
    
GROUP BY
    Salary
    
ORDER BY
    Salary ASC

paragraphs.text:
val highestPaying = data
    .select("Business Title", "Minimum Qual Requirements", "Salary Range To")
    .filter(data("Salary Range To") > 140000)
    .sort($"Salary Range To".desc)
    .distinct
    
z.show(highestPaying)
